control-key-modifier.name: Use 'Ctrl' key as tool modifier
control-key-modifier.description: When enabled, you can hold 'Ctrl' to use the tool

hide-info-button.name: Hide info button
hide-info-button.description: Hide that small blue info button at the lower left corner of the large button in editor

move-slider.name: Fix interface overlapping
move-slider.description: This mod adds two extra buttons to editor upper left menu. In some cases they may overlap with a <cg>slider</c>. Enabling this setting will move the slider to the right, which will probably fix the overlapping

preview-color.name: Preview color
preview-color.description:
This setting, turns off default <cp>pink highlight</c> for selected objects, while using the tool on the <cy>Color trigger</c> or <cy>Pulse trigger</c>. 
(this allows you to preview the actual objects color)

smart-filter.name: Smart Filter
smart-filter.description: Ok, this is a bit complex thing (that's why it's disabled by default). But it is actually really <cy>powerful</c>. Let's say you've selected a bunch of blocks and triggers. By default if you connect them to the (let's say) spawn trigger, no options will be offered to you (because you can't "spawn" the blocks - you can only spawn the triggers). But when the <cg>Smart Filter</c> is enabled you will be offered an options as when selecting only triggers. These options will appear in the menu with the <cy>*</c> sign at the end. Additionally only filtered objects will keep their <cp>pink selection</c> and the tool will be applied exclusively to them.

show-old-variant.name: Show the 'old' option
show-old-variant.description:
This is an option that allows you to add source objects to the group, that is <cy>currently</c> specified in the trigger you are configuring. This is a very handy option when the trigger already activates a group and you just want to add a new object to this group. 
Note 1: Option will appear in the lower menu under a name 'old' (+groupID).
 Note 2: This setting is disabled by default for less confusion.

default-copy-group.name: Default behavior is copy group
default-copy-group.description:
When the <cb>destination object</c> has no settings to change (for example, if the it is a simple block, spike, or some kind of decoration), the tool is not applied by default. But when this setting is enabled, the default action will be a suggestion to copy one of the the <cb>destination object</c> groups to the <cb>source objects</c>.
 Note: <cr>I do not recommend enabling this setting as it is confusing and is not really useful.</c>

fix-next-item-id.name: Fix getNextFreeItemID() behavior
fix-next-item-id.description:
Robtop's implementation of <cg>getNextFreeItemID()</c> function does not take into account item IDs in the count triggers, instant count triggers, edit item triggers and even items themselves:) So I've made a fixed version of it which resolves this issue. 
This is enabled using this setting. 
(Note: this change will be exclusive for Triggers Wiring Tool)
